The metric chosen to select the characteristic number in the study was the cumulative variance interpretation rate. This metric measures the proportion of variance in the data that is explained by the selected number of characteristics. By selecting the appropriate characteristic number based on the cumulative variance interpretation rate, the researchers were able to effectively identify Bachu mushrooms.

The study found that the cumulative variance interpretation rate can be used to select the characteristic number and achieve accurate identification of Bachu mushrooms. The classification results showed that the accuracy of identifying Bachu mushrooms based on the caps data was 99.06%, and based on the stalks data was 99.82%. Therefore, this metric has proven to be effective in identifying Bachu mushrooms and can be used as a reliable method in future applications.
